channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Security Access Manager Appliance
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Security Access Manager Appliance

item.title: CVE-2018-1887|2024-09-17T01:26:54.643Z -- ibm -- security%20access%20manager%20appliance
item.description: IBM Security Access Manager Appliance 9.0.1.0, 9.0.2.0, 9.0.3.0, 9.0.4.0, and 9.0.5.0 contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key, which it uses for its own inbound authentication, outbound communication to external components, or encryption of internal data. IBM X-Force ID: 152078.

item.title: CVE-2018-1653|2024-09-17T01:21:32.639Z -- ibm -- security%20access%20manager%20appliance
item.description: IBM Security Access Manager Appliance 9.0.1.0, 9.0.2.0, 9.0.3.0, 9.0.4.0, and 9.0.5.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 144726.

item.title: CVE-2020-4395|2024-09-17T00:52:22.785Z -- ibm -- security%20access%20manager%20appliance
item.description: IBM Security Access Manager Appliance 9.0.7 does not invalidate session after logout which could allow an authenticated user to impersonate another user on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 179358.
